reviewText: Excellent price!  Fast delivery!

Love this series. 10 is my fave Doctor. Martha is a good companion because she's quick and book smart, but not one of my favorites overall.
Great DVD!  It was good to see the slightly longer versions of these episodes.
More Doctor.  Who??? Amazing...what more can I say give me MO',  Give me Mo'.

Buy this set.

With this set, not only do you get more episodes on less discs (so you have less to scratch or lose), but it will last you longer than the box set. The Box sets have an annoying fold-out set up where the plastic casings break easily when you take the disc in and out. The hot glue holding everything together starts to come off after two years or so.

I lost my Series 4 box set to this fate and Series 3 is not to far behind. So I'm really glad that they are rereleasing these. They are two disc DVDs. So I know from past dvds and experience that these will last. This set is really great.

But despite anything else, consider the prices!

6 Disc Fold Out Box Set - $45-$80 (On the expensive side, but if you like bonus features, it's got quite a lot. This set doesn't)

6 Disc DVD Set - $30-$45 (Cheaper, but it's still got a lot of discs. Higher probability of scratching, however less episodes per disc to lose.)

This, 2 Disc Half Season DVD - $12-$25 for half a season, making it $24-$50 for the whole season. And $50 is pushing it. Plus you only have four discs rather than six to scratch.

It's up to you. All your preference. Get the bonus Features with the Box Set, Save Space with the 6 Disc DVD Set, or get this longer lasting/safer set.

Happy collecting!
EXTERMIATE THE DOCTOR!
It's David Tennant as the doctor. Nuff said.
It was ok, but it was missing the second disk.
Shakespeare speech was very brilliant long living legend historian.

Good quality DVDs of the tenth Doctor's best season!  The two part sets are much cheaper than buying the whole set, and the only thing missing is Doctor Who Confidential - which is fun, but not worth paying double for.

All of Series 3 is good Doctor Who, especially "Blink" (in Part Two) so I give Part One 4 stars.  However, I originally bought the entire series 3, as well as the entire series 2 eight or ten years ago and while watching them again I discovered that almost all of the disks had become unplayable through degeneration or corruption.  I've got DVDs I've had twenty years, even ones I've used for recording and not had a similar problem.  It made me wonder if it was worth buying Doctor Who disks, especially with the prices of new episodes.  To date, I've had no problem with the parts 1 and 2 of series 2 and 3 which I purchased, but I've only had them a few months.
love it

A fantastic season!  the doctor is back and with the amazing martha jones, who has got to be hands down the most underrated and unappreciated of his companions.  all episodes are incredible.  Smith and Jones has got to be one of the best episodes that introduces a new companion.  Shakespeare Code, Gridlock, Daleks in Manhattan, and The Lazarus Experiment are also incredibly great!  David Tennant, Freema and all the other supporting actors and guest stars are also really good as well.
Great series
Good if you don't have the money to get the complete series sets, but I miss the Dr. Who Confidentials and DT's own videos.

I love this series. I would recommend it, if you just want episodes of the doctor and not the extras.
Love David Tennant as Dr Who
Love love love it!
I was introduced to Dr Who in the early sixtys, saw the movie that started it all.
As much as I hate these split season DVDs, I got this because of the massive discount. Saved about $30 to buy two parts rather than buying the one complete set.

I've only started watching Doctor Who last year, so I had a lot of catching up to do before the new season started. I love that the previous seasons (or series as they're called) were being re-released so that I can get them while they're at a lower price.

With this entry into the Doctor's adventures, we meet the brilliant Martha Jones. Played by Freema Agyeman, she is quite possibly the best, and most tragic companions of the show.
With so many returning favorites, from both the current iteration and the classic series, this is a must have.
Go ahead and bundle up this purchase with the part two set of this series so you don't have to wait for it to arrive at your door. If you haven't already become hooked and bought everything.
This replaced an older original release of this series of which the DVDs stop playing. I hope this set last longer.
